words.definition: To ail a person or group is to cause them problems or make them sick.
words.example: My GS brother went to the doctor to see what was ailing him.

words.definition: An ally is someone who agrees to help or support you.
words.example: The GS two countries were allies in the war.

words.definition: To boast is to talk about how good you are.
words.example: The GS he boasted about his high grades.

words.definition: To bounce is to move something up and away after it hits a surface.
words.example: The boy bounced the ball on the ground.

words.definition: A bully is a person who is mean to others.
words.example: The GS the bully teased the smaller boy.

words.definition: Carbohydrates are substances in food like bread that give you energy.
words.example: The GS you should eat carbohydrates before a race.

words.definition: To crawl is to move slowly on your hands and knees.
words.example: The GS the baby crawled across the floor.

words.definition: To defeat someone is to beat them in a game or battle.
words.example: The GS the team defeated their rivals.

words.definition: To dial is to push the buttons on a phone to call someone.
words.example: The GS I dialed her number, but she didn't answer.

words.definition: When someone or something is dominant, they are stronger than others.
words.example: The GS the king was the dominant figure in the country.

words.definition: If you show mercy, you choose not to punish or harm someone.
words.example: The GS the king showed mercy to the prisoner.

words.definition: To nod is to move your head up and down.
words.example: The GS she nodded to show that she understood.

words.definition: An opponent is someone who fights or competes against you.
words.example: The GS his opponent in the game was very strong.

words.definition: To quarrel is to argue or fight.
words.example: The GS the couple quarreled about money.

words.definition: A rival is someone that is trying to keep you from getting what you want.
words.example: The GS the two businesses were rivals.

words.definition: When a part of your body is sore, it hurts.
words.example: My GS legs were sore after the long walk.

words.definition: To sting is to cause a sharp pain by pushing a small part into the skin.
words.example: The GS the bee stung him on the arm.

words.definition: To strain is to try very hard.
words.example: The GS he strained to lift the heavy box.

words.definition: Torture is something that causes you great physical or mental pain.
words.example: The GS the long wait was torture for him.

words.definition: To wrestle is to play a game where you try to push someone to the ground.
words.example: The GS the two boys liked to wrestle.
